publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

title-group.subtitle: An Important and Often Overlooked Survey Analysis Tool

bio.p: LCDR Lew Anderson is a US Navy SEAL officer currently stationed at Special Operations Command Korea. He has attended many specialty schools such as Basic Underwater Demolition/SEALs (BUD/S), Dive Supervisor, and Military Free Fall School, but the most mentally challenging school he has ever attended was Naval Postgraduate School, where he received an MS in operations research. LCDR Anderson has a BS in mathematics education from Purdue University and actually used this degree, teaching Algebra I to eighth graders in Tell City, Indiana.

Ronald D. Fricker, Jr. is the head of the Statistics Department at Virginia Tech. He was formerly a professor in the Operations Research Department of the Naval Postgraduate School. He received his PhD in statistics from Yale University. An author of more than 70 papers, monographs, and book chapters, Professor Fricker is a Fellow of the American Statistical Association and an Elected Member of the International Statistical Institute. He is on the editorial boards of Statistics, Politics, and Policy and the International Journal of Quality Engineering and Technology.
